original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation;_

_the old has gone, the new has come! _(2 Cor. 5:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Roll this over in your mind for a minute; by a carpenter

mankind was made, and only by that same carpenter can

mankind be remade, if we will allow Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for Your creating power,

but most all I thank You for recreating me. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Roll this over in your mind for a minute; by a carpenter mankind was made, and only by that same carpenter can mankind be remade, if we will allow Him.
original_verse_text: "If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has gone, the new has come!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through Your Son, the Word made flesh, all things were created and all things are being made new. We praise You for the power of Your redemption, that in Christ we are new creations, the old has passed away and the new has come. Lord, open our hearts to receive Your transforming grace, that we may be conformed to the image of Your Son and live as ambassadors of Your reconciling love. Amen.
reflection: Roll this over in your mind for a minute; by a carpenter, mankind was made, and only by that same carpenter can mankind be remade, if we will allow him.
subject: Remade by the Carpenter
verse_text: "If anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation; the old has gone, the new has come!

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"My sheep listen to My voice. and FOLLOW Me."_

_ _(Jn. 10:27)

_"GO into all the world and preach the good news_

_to all creation." _(Mk. 16:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The religion of Jesus begins with the verb "FOLLOW"

and ends with the word "GO"

Jesus' purpose was to do the will of God; when we follow

Jesus we should have the same purpose. Are you sharing

the Word.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord create in me a Christ-like purpose. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The religion of Jesus begins with the verb "FOLLOW" and ends with the word "GO" Jesus' purpose was to do the will of God; when we follow Jesus we should have the same purpose. Are you sharing the Word.
original_verse_text: "My sheep listen to My voice. and FOLLOW Me. " (John 10:27) "GO into all the world and preach the good news to all creation. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the Great Commission given to us by Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. Help us to faithfully follow in His footsteps, going forth to all the world and making disciples, baptizing them in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. May we be bold in proclaiming the good news of salvation, that all may know the truth and be set free. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may fulfill Your will and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The religion of Jesus begins with the verb "FOLLOW" and ends with the word "GO." Jesus' purpose was to do the will of God; when we follow Jesus, we should have the same purpose. Are you sharing the Word?
subject: Embrace Jesus' Purpose: Follow and Go
verse_text: "My sheep listen to My voice. and FOLLOW Me. " (John 10:27) "GO into all the world and preach the good news to all creation. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"There is no one righteous, _

_not even one. _(Ro. 3:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Christian church is not a congregation

of righteous people. It is a society of those

who know they are not good. (Dwight E. Stevens.)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I know that I am a sinner

only saved by Your grace, thank You Lord. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Christian church is not a congregation of righteous people. It is a society of those who know they are not good. (Dwight E. Stevens. )
original_verse_text: "There is no one righteous, not even one.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that none of us are righteous, for all have sinned and fall short of Your glory. We are not a people of perfection, but a people in need of Your grace and redemption. Lord, we thank You for the gift of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who died to save us from our sins and to restore us to right relationship with You. Forgive us, Lord, and empower us by Your Spirit to live lives that bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The Christian church is not a congregation of righteous people. It is a society of those who know they are not good. (Dwight E. Moody.)
subject: Imperfect People, Perfect Savior
verse_text: "There is no one righteous, not even one.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Unless you change and become like little children,_

_you will never enter the kingdom of heaven. _(Mt. 18:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When you think about it, I don't think any one of us

have ever seen any stronger faith than what we have

seen in a child.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I beg of You to create in me again

a child like faith. Amen.
original_reflection_text: When you think about it, I don't think any one of us have ever seen any stronger faith than what we have seen in a child.
original_verse_text: "Unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts of humility, seeking to emulate the faith of a child. Help us to approach You with the same wonder, trust, and dependence that a child has, for truly, the kingdom of heaven belongs to those who receive it in this manner. May we never lose the simplicity and sincerity of a child's heart, but instead, grow in our understanding of Your steadfast love and grace. Guide us, Lord, to become like little children, that we may inherit the eternal life You have promised. Amen.
reflection: When you think about it, I don't think any one of us has ever seen any stronger faith than what we have seen in a child.
subject: Childlike Faith Inspires Believers
verse_text: "Unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"May my meditation be pleasing to Him_

_as I rejoice in the Lord." _(Ps. 104:34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As we lie down each evening, what do we have

on our mind, are we thinking about God? If so,

are we truly concerned about being in His will?

Are we truly as concerned as we should be?

SORRY FOR THE E-MAIL PROBLEMS WE HAVE JUST MOVED

TO AN ASSISTED LIVING APARTMENT AT THE SUGGESTION OF

MARCIE'S DOCTOR.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord forgive me for my unfaithfulness,

Help me to walk in the light of Your ways. Amen.
original_reflection_text: As we lie down each evening, what do we have on our mind, are we thinking about God? If so, are we truly concerned about being in His will? Are we truly as concerned as we should be? SORRY FOR THE E-MAIL PROBLEMS WE HAVE JUST MOVED TO AN ASSISTED LIVING APARTMENT AT THE SUGGESTION OF MARCIE'S DOCTOR.
original_verse_text: "May my meditation be pleasing to Him as I rejoice in the Lord. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our thoughts and meditations should be centered on You. Help us to be ever mindful of Your presence, seeking to align our lives with Your will. May the peace that transcends all understanding guard our hearts and minds in Christ Jesus, as we cast our cares upon You. In the stillness of the night, may our souls find rest and rejoice in Your steadfast love. Amen.
reflection: As we lie down each evening, what do we have on our mind? Are we thinking about God? If so, are we truly concerned about being in His will? Are we truly as concerned as we should be? Sorry for the email problems. We have just moved to an assisted living apartment at the suggestion of Marcie's doctor.
subject: Resting in God's Will
verse_text: "May my meditation be pleasing to Him as I rejoice in the Lord. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be content with what ever you have" _(Heb. 13:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I believe that to be content with little is difficult:

To be content with much is impossible.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I struggle in both these

areas, help me to be content so that life does not

become such a struggle. Amen.
original_reflection_text: I believe that to be content with little is difficult: To be content with much is impossible.
original_verse_text: "Be content with what ever you have"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true contentment is a gift from You. Help us to learn, as Your servant Paul did, to be content in all circumstances, whether we have little or much. Grant us the wisdom to find our sufficiency in You alone, and the strength to be satisfied with what You have provided. May we never forget Your promise to never leave or forsake us. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: I believe that to be content with little is difficult. To be content with much is impossible.
subject: Contentment in Abundance and Scarcity
verse_text: "Be content with what ever you have"

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Whom Himself bore our sins in His own_

_body on the cross." _(I Pet. 2:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Never forget that the heart of salvation is the Cross

of Christ. The reason that salvation is so easy to

obtain is, that it cost God so much.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord it is beyond my understanding that You loved

us so much that You were willing to allow your own Son

to be sacrifice for our sins that we might have eternal life.

Help me to always accept this gift by faith. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Never forget that the heart of salvation is the Cross of Christ. The reason that salvation is so easy to obtain is, that it cost God so much.
original_verse_text: "Whom Himself bore our sins in His own body on the cross. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who bore our sins on the cross and secured our salvation. In Your great love, You demonstrated Your mercy by sending Christ to die for us while we were still sinners. May we never take for granted the immense cost of our redemption, but instead live in gratitude and devotion to You. Help us to share this good news with others, that they too may find forgiveness and eternal life. Amen.
reflection: Never forget that the heart of salvation is the Cross of Christ. The reason that salvation is so easy to obtain is that it cost God so much.
subject: The Cross of Salvation
verse_text: "Whom Himself bore our sins in His own body on the cross. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Thou shall call His name Jesus, for He shall save_

_His people from their sins." _( Mt. 1:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many think of Christ's love on the cross, they think of

His work in heaven as Intercessor, but do we realize

that He is a living Person in heaven who thinks of us each

day and longs to reveal Himself.

Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, through Your unbroken fellowship

with us, help me to learn the secret of a truly godly life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Many think of Christ's love on the cross, they think of His work in heaven as Intercessor, but do we realize that He is a living Person in heaven who thinks of us each day and longs to reveal Himself.
original_verse_text: "Thou shall call His name Jesus, for He shall save His people from their sins. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who came to save us from our sins. We are grateful for His eternal intercession on our behalf, as He ever lives to make supplication for us. Lord, open our hearts to the reality of Christ's living presence in heaven, that we may know the depth of His love and the power of His ongoing work in our lives. May we draw near to You with confidence, through the mediation of our Savior. Amen.
reflection: Many think of Christ's love on the cross, they think of His work in heaven as Intercessor, but do we realize that He is a living Person in heaven who thinks of us each day and longs to reveal Himself?
subject: Risen Christ's Eternal Thoughts
verse_text: "Thou shall call His name Jesus, for He shall save His people from their sins. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Stand firm, with the belt of truth buckled around _

_your waist. _(Eph. 6:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In our Christian life we battle against rulers and

authorities (the evil forces of fallen angels lead by

Satan I Pet.5:8). To combat these attacks, we must

depend upon Gods power and use every piece of

His armor.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, it goes without saying that

I have to depend upon Your power to combat the

powers of this world. So I pray, protect m from

the evil forces of this world. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In our Christian life we battle against rulers and authorities (the evil forces of fallen angels lead by Satan I Peter 5:8). To combat these attacks, we must depend upon Gods power and use every piece of His armor.
original_verse_text: "Stand firm, with the belt of truth buckled around your waist.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, aware of the spiritual battles we face in this world. Help us to stand firm, girded with the truth of Your Word, shielded by the righteousness of Christ, and protected by the gospel of peace. Grant us the faith to resist the devil, steadfast in our trust in You. May we be strengthened by Your power, that we may stand against the schemes of the evil one. We ask this in the mighty name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: In our Christian life, we battle against rulers and authorities (the evil forces of fallen angels led by Satan, 1 Peter 5:8). To combat these attacks, we must depend upon God's power and use every piece of His armor.
subject: Depend on God's Armor
verse_text: "Stand firm, with the belt of truth buckled around your waist.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Pray at all times, in the Spirit"_ (Eph.. 6:18a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

How can anyone pray at all times? One way is to make

quick, brief prayers, a habitual response to every situation.

You can make prayer your life and your life a prayer while

living in a world that needs God's powerful influence.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord of all grace and mercy, instill in me a prayerful

spirit. Grant me a loving spirit with a concern for the needs

of others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: How can anyone pray at all times? One way is to make quick, brief prayers, a habitual response to every situation. You can make prayer your life and your life a prayer while living in a world that needs God's powerful influence.
original_verse_text: "Pray at all times, in the Spirit"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your sovereignty and the power of prayer. Help us to cultivate a constant awareness of Your presence, that we may lift up our petitions to You without ceasing, casting our anxieties upon You. Grant us the peace that surpasses all understanding, as we trust in Your perfect plan for our lives. May our lives be a continuous prayer, a testimony to Your goodness and grace. Amen.
reflection: How can anyone pray at all times? One way is to make quick, brief prayers, a habitual response to every situation. You can make prayer your life and your life a prayer while living in a world that needs God's powerful influence.
subject: Pray Without Ceasing
verse_text: "Pray at all times, in the Spirit"

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Written to God's holy people in Ephesus,_

_who are fa__ithful followers of Jesus Christ." _(Eph. 1:1b)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"Faithful followers of Jesus Christ"_ What an excellent

reputation. What would it take for others to characterize

you as a "faithful follower" of Jesus Christ? Remember that

to receive such a characterization you must old fast to your

faith--and faithfully obey God day by day.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, sensitize me to Your Holy Spirit's guidance each

day so that I would be recognized as a faithful follower of our

Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "Faithful followers of Jesus Christ" What an excellent reputation. What would it take for others to characterize you as a "faithful follower" of Jesus Christ? Remember that to receive such a characterization you must old fast to your faith--and faithfully obey God day by day.
original_verse_text: "Written to God's holy people in Ephesus, who are faithful followers of Jesus Christ. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You as Your faithful followers, seeking to walk in obedience to Your Word. Help us to remain rooted and built up in Christ, abounding in thanksgiving as we live out our faith with steadfastness. May our lives be a testimony of Your transforming power, that others may see Your goodness and be drawn to the hope found in You. We desire to be known as those who are firmly established in the truth of Your gospel. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: "Faithful followers of Jesus Christ." What an excellent reputation. What would it take for others to characterize you as a "faithful follower" of Jesus Christ? Remember that to receive such a characterization, you must hold fast to your faith and faithfully obey God day by day.
subject: Faithful Followers of Christ
verse_text: "Written to God's holy people in Ephesus, who are faithful followers of Jesus Christ. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"How we praise God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, _

_who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing, in the _

_heavenly realms because we belong to Christ."_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Being "blessed with every spiritual blessing" means, that in Christ

we have all the blessings of knowing God. Those blessing include:

Being chosen for salvation, Being adopted as God's children, Insight,

Forgiveness, The gifts of the Spirit, The power to do God's will,

The hope of living forever with Christ.

Because we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy

these blessings now.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank you Lord for the many blessings that are ours

though our faith in Your Son Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Being "blessed with every spiritual blessing" means, that in Christ we have all the blessings of knowing God. Those blessing include: Being chosen for salvation, Being adopted as God's children, Insight, Forgiveness, The gifts of the Spirit, The power to do God's will, The hope of living forever with Christ. Because we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy these blessings now.
original_verse_text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the spiritual blessings we have in Christ. Thank You for choosing us, adopting us as Your children, and granting us the gifts of the Spirit to do Your will. Help us to cherish the intimate relationship we have with You, and to live in the hope of eternal life with Christ. May we faithfully steward the blessings You have so graciously bestowed upon us. Amen.
reflection: Being "blessed with every spiritual blessing" means that in Christ we have all the blessings of knowing God. Those blessings include: being chosen for salvation, being adopted as God's children, insight, forgiveness, the gifts of the Spirit, the power to do God's will, the hope of living forever with Christ. Because we have an intimate relationship with Christ, we can enjoy these blessings now.
subject: Blessed with Spiritual Blessings
verse_text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Long ago even before He made the world, God loved us_

_and chose us in Christ to be holy and without fault in His_

_eyes." _(Eph. 1:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul says God "_chose us_" to emphasize that salvation depends

totally on God. We are not saved because we deserve it, but

because God is gracious and freely gives salvation, All we can

do is express our thanks, for His wonderful love.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy

gifting us the free gift of eternal life though faith in Your Son

our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen..
original_reflection_text: Paul says God "chose us" to emphasize that salvation depends totally on God. We are not saved because we deserve it, but because God is gracious and freely gives salvation, All we can do is express our thanks, for His wonderful love.
original_verse_text: "Long ago even before He made the world, God loved us and chose us in Christ to be holy and without fault in His eyes. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in humble gratitude, acknowledging that we are all sinners, falling short of Your glory. Yet, in Your infinite grace, You have chosen us, not because of our own merit, but because of Your boundless love. We thank You for the gift of salvation, freely offered through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our lives reflect the wonder of Your redemption, as we seek to honor and glorify You in all that we do. Amen.
reflection: Paul says God "chose us" to emphasize that salvation depends totally on God. We are not saved because we deserve it, but because God is gracious and freely gives salvation. All we can do is express our thanks for His wonderful love.
subject: Saved by God's Gracious Choice
verse_text: "Long ago even before He made the world, God loved us and chose us in Christ to be holy and without fault in His eyes. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Having predestined us unto the adoption of children _

_by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good _

_pleasure of His will." _(Eph. 1:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The purpose of His predestination was that we should

experience the fact of becoming his children. It is through

Christ's sacrifice and our faith, that we have become His

very own to serve Him and glorify Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank you again today for Your sacrificial love that caused

You to go the way of the cross as a substitute to pay the debt

for my sins. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The purpose of His predestination was that we should experience the fact of becoming his children. It is through Christ's sacrifice and our faith, that we have become His very own to serve Him and glorify Him.
original_verse_text: "Having predestined us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus, we have been adopted as Your children. By the power of Your Spirit, may we live as Your beloved, walking in the freedom and joy of our new identity. Guide us to serve You faithfully and to bring glory to Your name. In Christ's name, Amen.
reflection: The purpose of His predestination was that we should experience the fact of becoming His children. It is through Christ's sacrifice and our faith that we have become His very own to serve Him and glorify Him.
subject: Becoming His Treasured Children
verse_text: "Having predestined us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"In whom we have redemption, through His blood._

_the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of _

_His grace._ (Eph. 1:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The phrase "WE HAVE" means we have a present possession,

not a future prospect. "REDEMPTION" is a deliverance from

the bondage of sin. Believers have been delivered from

slavery of self, sin, and Satan. _"If the Son therefore_

_shall make you free, you shall be free indeed."_

(Jn. 8:36)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for what the precious

blood of Jesus has done for all believers. I thank You for

Your grace and mercy for such a sinner as me. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The phrase "WE HAVE" means we have a present possession, not a future prospect. "REDEMPTION" is a deliverance from the bondage of sin. Believers have been delivered from slavery of self, sin, and Satan. "If the Son therefore shall make you free, you shall be free indeed. " (John 8:36)
original_verse_text: "In whom we have redemption, through His blood. the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through the blood of Your Son, we have been redeemed from the bondage of sin. By the power of the Holy Spirit, may we walk in the freedom that Christ has secured for us, no longer enslaved to our own desires but living for Your glory. Lord, continue to set us free, that we may truly be free indeed. Amen.
reflection: The phrase "We have" means we have a present possession, not a future prospect. "Redemption" is a deliverance from the bondage of sin. Believers have been delivered from slavery of self, sin, and Satan. "If the Son therefore shall make you free, you shall be free indeed." (John 8:36)
subject: Possess the Redemption Granted
verse_text: "In whom we have redemption, through His blood. the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of His grace.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Having made known onto us the mystery of His will,_

_according to His good pleasure which He hath purposed _

_in Himself." _(Eph. 1:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God once had a plan that was hidden from human reason for

ages (Ro. 16:25) but now is divinely revealed (Col. 1:26-27).

Which He made known in Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You for sending Jesus to unite Jews and Gentiles

into one body with Christ as the head. I thank you for the

gift of eternal life that became possible through His

resurrection to all who believe. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God once had a plan that was hidden from human reason for ages (Romans 16:25) but now is divinely revealed (Colossians 1:26-27). Which He made known in Christ.
original_verse_text: "Having made known onto us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He hath purposed in Himself. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that Your eternal plan, once hidden, has now been revealed in the person and work of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We marvel at the mystery of Your wisdom, that through the gospel, the riches of Your grace and the hope of eternal life are made known to all who believe. Grant us understanding and faith to embrace the fullness of Your revealed purpose. In Christ's name, Amen.
reflection: God once had a plan that was hidden from human reason for ages (Romans 16:25) but now is divinely revealed (Colossians 1:26-27), which He made known in Christ.
subject: Divinely Revealed Plan in Christ
verse_text: "Having made known onto us the mystery of His will, according to His good pleasure which He hath purposed in Himself. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY: (follow up of verse 9)

_"That in the dispensation of the fullness of times He will_

_gather together in one all things in Christ, both of which_

_are of heaven, and which are on earth, even in Him. _(Eph. 1:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

To sum it up: all things will be brought together in orderly and

harmonious completion. Christ is the center of the universe, which

one day will be brought together into one harmonious whole.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord, for that wonderful --wonderful day when heaven

comes down and washes all my sins away. Amen

_ _
original_reflection_text: To sum it up: all things will be brought together in orderly and harmonious completion. Christ is the center of the universe, which one day will be brought together into one harmonious whole.
original_verse_text: (follow up of verse 9) "That in the dispensation of the fullness of times He will gather together in one all things in Christ, both of which are of heaven, and which are on earth, even in Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the glorious truth that all things were created through Christ and for Christ. We marvel at the promise that one day all things will be brought together in Christ, united under His sovereign rule. Lord, help us to live in light of this truth, submitting our lives to Your perfect plan and purpose. May Your kingdom come and Your will be done, until the day when all creation is restored to its rightful order in Christ. Amen.
reflection: To sum it up: all things will be brought together in orderly and harmonious completion. Christ is the center of the universe, which one day will be brought together into one harmonious whole.
subject: Harmonious Completion in Christ
verse_text: (follow up of verse 9) "That in the dispensation of the fullness of times He will gather together in one all things in Christ, both of which are of heaven, and which are on earth, even in Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"That we should be to the praise of His glory, who first _

_trusted in Christ. In whom you also trusted after you _

_heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation."_

(Eph. 1:12-13a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Faith is the connecting link between man and Christ.

Notice the order here: "They first heard God's Good News."

and then: "They put their trust in Christ." ". faith cometh

by hearing, and hearing by the Word of God." (Ro. 10:17)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for providing the connecting link between

man and Christ. I think You for the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Faith is the connecting link between man and Christ. Notice the order here: "They first heard God's Good News. " and then: "They put their trust in Christ. " ". faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the Word of God. " (Romans 10:17)
original_verse_text: "That we should be to the praise of His glory, who first trusted in Christ. In whom you also trusted after you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that faith is the bridge that connects us to Your Son, Jesus Christ. We thank You for the Good News that we have heard, the Word that has stirred our souls and led us to put our trust in You. Lord, help us to be faithful messengers, that others may hear the Gospel and be drawn to the saving knowledge of Christ. May our lives be a reflection of Your love, that we may point the way to the One who is the source of all life and hope. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Faith is the connecting link between man and Christ. Notice the order here: "They first heard God's Good News," and then: "They put their trust in Christ." "Faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the Word of God." (Romans 10:17)
subject: Connecting with Christ Through Faith
verse_text: "That we should be to the praise of His glory, who first trusted in Christ. In whom you also trusted after you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_" Who (Holy S.) is given as a pledge of our inheritance_

_with a view to the redemption, of God's own possession,_

_to the praise of His glory" _(Eph. 1:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Since God has graciously give us the Holy Spirit and we

now have a foretaste of heaven, we have His guarantee

that He will perform all that He has promised. (Phil. 1:6)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of Your

Holy Spirit. I pray that I would be sensitive and obedient

to His leading and guidance. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Since God has graciously give us the Holy Spirit and we now have a foretaste of heaven, we have His guarantee that He will perform all that He has promised. (Philippians 1:6)
original_verse_text: " Who (Holy S. ) is given as a pledge of our inheritance with a view to the redemption, of God's own possession, to the praise of His glory"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Holy Spirit, which serves as a guarantee of the eternal inheritance You have promised to all who believe in Your Son. As we eagerly await the redemption of our bodies and the fulfillment of Your perfect plan, fill us with hope and steadfast faith, that we may persevere through the trials of this world. May Your Spirit continue to work in us, transforming us into the likeness of Christ, until the day we are welcomed into Your glorious presence. Amen.
reflection: Since God has graciously given us the Holy Spirit, and we now have a foretaste of heaven, we have His guarantee that He will perform all that He has promised. (Philippians 1:6)
subject: Guaranteed Completion in Christ
verse_text: " Who (Holy S. ) is given as a pledge of our inheritance with a view to the redemption, of God's own possession, to the praise of His glory"

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"_I make mention of you in my prayers, that the God of our Lord _

_Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of
wisdom _

_and revelation in the knowledge of Him." _(Eph. 1:16b-17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This was Paul's continual fixed habit--Prayer and thanksgiving go

together. (Wisdom and revelation) has to do with new truths.

The Spirit knows the deep things of God (I Cor. 2:11). He is our

teacher (Jn. 14:26). We all need a fuller knowledge of Christ.

(Phil. 3:10)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for Your Spirit's work, enlightening all

believers of the deeper things of You, enlightening us into

a fuller knowledge of Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This was Paul's continual fixed habit--Prayer and thanksgiving go together. (Wisdom and revelation) has to do with new truths. The Spirit knows the deep things of God (I Corinthians 2:11). He is our teacher (John 14:26). We all need a fuller knowledge of Christ. (Philippians 3:10)
original_verse_text: "I make mention of you in my prayers, that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging our need for Your wisdom and revelation. As Your Spirit intercedes for us with groanings too deep for words, we ask that You would grant us a deeper understanding of Christ and the mysteries of Your kingdom. May our knowledge and love for You grow ever deeper, that we may walk in a manner worthy of Your calling. We trust in Your Spirit to guide us and reveal the hidden things of God. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: This was Paul's continual, fixed habit. Prayer and thanksgiving go together. (Wisdom and revelation) have to do with new truths. The Spirit knows the deep things of God (1 Corinthians 2:11). He is our teacher (John 14:26). We all need a fuller knowledge of Christ (Philippians 3:10).
subject: Constant Prayer and Thanksgiving
verse_text: "I make mention of you in my prayers, that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Give thanks in all things to God the Father, in_

_the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.". _(Eph. 5:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Thank God NOT for the problems in your life, BUT

thank Him for the STRENGTH He is building in you

through the difficult experiences in your life. You

can be sure that God's perfect love will see you through.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord for all the difficult situations You have

brought my family through. I thank You for the promise

of eternal life where there will be no pain or tears, I pray

this in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Thank God NOT for the problems in your life, BUT thank Him for the STRENGTH He is building in you through the difficult experiences in your life. You can be sure that God's perfect love will see you through.
original_verse_text: "Give thanks in all things to God the Father, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. ".
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the strength and resilience You are building within us through the trials and tribulations we face. Even in the midst of life's difficulties, we trust that Your perfect love is guiding us and working all things together for our good, according to Your divine purpose. Lord, help us to cultivate a heart of gratitude, ever mindful of Your unwavering presence and the blessings that emerge from our struggles. Amen.
reflection: Thank God not for the problems in your life, but thank Him for the strength He is building in you through the difficult experiences in your life. You can be sure that God's perfect love will see you through.
subject: Strength Forged Through Difficulties
verse_text: "Give thanks in all things to God the Father, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. ".

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened,_

_so that you will know what is the hope of His calling,_

_what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in_

_the saints". ._ (Eph. 1:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The soul has eyes that need to be enlightened (and also) flooded

with divine light. The purpose of spiritual illumination and

spiritual perception is so that believers may know and experience

God's calling, inheritance, and power. His summons is a calling

into a new life in Christ, through Christ, for Christ, and with
Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You recognized that as

believers we needed further spiritual illumination to understand

a new life in Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The soul has eyes that need to be enlightened (and also) flooded with divine light. The purpose of spiritual illumination and spiritual perception is so that believers may know and experience God's calling, inheritance, and power. His summons is a calling into a new life in Christ, through Christ, for Christ, and with Christ.
original_verse_text: "I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened, so that you will know what is the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints".
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking the illumination of Your divine light. Open the eyes of our souls, that we may know and experience the fullness of Your calling, the riches of Your inheritance, and the immeasurable greatness of Your power at work within us. May we walk in the freedom and confidence of being Your beloved children, led by Your Spirit, and empowered to live for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: The soul has eyes that need to be enlightened (and also) flooded with divine light. The purpose of spiritual illumination and spiritual perception is so that believers may know and experience God's calling, inheritance, and power. His summons is a calling into a new life in Christ, through Christ, for Christ, and with Christ.
subject: Enlightened Eyes Flooded with Light
verse_text: "I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened, so that you will know what is the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints".

original_content:
VERSES FOR TODAY:

_"What is the surpassing greatness of God's power toward us_

_who believe. These are in accordance with the working of the_

_strength of His might which He brought about in Christ, when_

_He raised Him from the dead. _(Eph. 1:19-20a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These verses speak of the immeasurable, more-than sufficient

greatness of God's dynamic power. We can depend fully upon

His power, which He made known to us in the resurrection of

Christ. A resurrection power that is available to us also.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of powers beyond human comprehension I thank You

for Your Son Jesus Christ, Who went to the Cross in my place

and paid my debt in full for the sins which I am guilty of. I

thank You for the promise of eternal life for all who believe

in Him. Amen.

Ps. I will be gone until next week - - - - Sorry
original_reflection_text: These verses speak of the immeasurable, more-than sufficient greatness of God's dynamic power. We can depend fully upon His power, which He made known to us in the resurrection of Christ. A resurrection power that is available to us also.
original_verse_text: "What is the surpassing greatness of God's power toward us who believe. These are in accordance with the working of the strength of His might which He brought about in Christ, when He raised Him from the dead.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the immeasurable greatness of Your power, which You have made known to us through the resurrection of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We thank You that this same power is available to us, empowering us to walk in newness of life, just as Christ was raised from the dead. May we rely fully on Your resurrection power to overcome sin and live for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: These verses speak of the immeasurable, more-than-sufficient greatness of God's dynamic power. We can depend fully upon His power, which He made known to us in the resurrection of Christ. A resurrection power that is available to us also.
subject: Resurrection Power Transforms Lives
verse_text: "What is the surpassing greatness of God's power toward us who believe. These are in accordance with the working of the strength of His might which He brought about in Christ, when He raised Him from the dead.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"You were dead in your trespasses and sins, in _

_which you formerly walked according to the _

_courses of this world, according to the prince _

_of this world." _(Eph. 2:1-2a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The phrase, _"YOU WERE DEAD" _paints a clear picture of what

man really is. Lost and spiritually dead not merely weakened,

incapacitated, disabled or sick. What Paul is describing is a

person who was waking the wrong path conforming to this world.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word, which is a lamp

onto my feet and a light onto my path, which shows me that I am a

sinner in need of Your saving grace. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The phrase, "YOU WERE DEAD" paints a clear picture of what man really is. Lost and spiritually dead not merely weakened, incapacitated, disabled or sick. What Paul is describing is a person who was waking the wrong path conforming to this world.
original_verse_text: "You were dead in your trespasses and sins, in which you formerly walked according to the courses of this world, according to the prince of this world. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the truth of Your Word that we were once dead in our trespasses and sins, walking according to the course of this world. We thank You that the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. May we turn from the ways of this world and live for You, the source of all life. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: The phrase, "You were dead" paints a clear picture of what man really is. Lost and spiritually dead, not merely weakened, incapacitated, disabled, or sick. What Paul is describing is a person who was walking the wrong path, conforming to this world.
subject: Awakened to New Life
verse_text: "You were dead in your trespasses and sins, in which you formerly walked according to the courses of this world, according to the prince of this world. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"God being rich in mercy, because of His great love_

_with which He loved us, even when we were dead in_

_our transgressions, made us alive together with Christ."_

(by grace you have been saved).

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What we should notice is God can meet our needs. He is wealthy

in mercy by His nature. Instead of dealing with us as we deserve,

He deals with us in compassionate mercy. This becomes very clear

in Jn. 3:16 where we see just how GREAT HIS LOVE IS. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord, I thank You for Your love and mercy not dealing

out to me what I deserve but loving me in spite of my sinful

nature. Amen
original_reflection_text: What we should notice is God can meet our needs. He is wealthy in mercy by His nature. Instead of dealing with us as we deserve, He deals with us in compassionate mercy. This becomes very clear in John 3:16 where we see just how GREAT HIS LOVE IS. .
original_verse_text: But because of his great love for us, God, who is rich in mercy, made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressions-it is by grace you have been saved.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for Your love and mercy are beyond measure. Though we are undeserving, You have shown us compassion and grace, sending Your Son to die for our sins. Lord, help us to fully grasp the depth of Your love, that we may be transformed by it and live as Your beloved children. May we ever seek to walk in the light of Your truth, reflecting Your mercy to a world in need. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What we should notice is God can meet our needs. He is wealthy in mercy by His nature. Instead of dealing with us as we deserve, He deals with us in compassionate mercy. This becomes very clear in John 3:16 where we see just how great His love is.
subject: Wealthy in Merciful Love
verse_text: But because of his great love for us, God, who is rich in mercy, made us alive with Christ even when we were dead in transgressions-it is by grace you have been saved.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"God raised us up with Him, and seated us with Him_

_in heavenly places in Christ Jesus." _(Eph. 2:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Notice if you would, this text is written in the past tense.

Christ WAS raised in a physical resurrection and we in a

past spiritual resurrection. God has dealt with us in Christ

and sees us in Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for Your loving kindness in what You

have done for us though the sacrifice of Your own Son

our Lord Jesus Christ. I thank You for His willingness

to go the way of the cross for my sins. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Notice if you would, this text is written in the past tense. Christ WAS raised in a physical resurrection and we in a past spiritual resurrection. God has dealt with us in Christ and sees us in Christ.
original_verse_text: "God raised us up with Him, and seated us with Him in heavenly places in Christ Jesus. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the glorious truth that in Christ, we have been raised to new life. Through the power of the Holy Spirit, may our hearts and minds be set on the things above, not on earthly things. Help us to live in the reality of our spiritual resurrection, seated with Christ in the heavenly realms. May our lives be a reflection of the eternal life we have in You. Amen.
reflection: Notice if you would, this text is written in the past tense. Christ was raised in a physical resurrection, and we in a past spiritual resurrection. God has dealt with us in Christ and sees us in Christ.
subject: Risen with Christ: New Life
verse_text: "God raised us up with Him, and seated us with Him in heavenly places in Christ Jesus. "

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY: (a continuation to previous verses)

_"So tat in ages to come He might show the surpassing _

_riches of His grace in kindness toward us in Christ_

_Jesus. _(Eph. 2:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God delights in showing great grace to great sinners.

What I see by the words (The ages to come) is that

God will show the trophies of His great grace throughout the endless ages of eternity (the great trophies) being

all who have accepted Christ as their Lord and Savior.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for Your grace, mercy and Your love for

a sinner like me, making it possible that I may have a place in

Your trophy case for all eternity. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God delights in showing great grace to great sinners. What I see by the words (The ages to come) is that God will show the trophies of His great grace throughout the endless ages of eternity (the great trophies) being all who have accepted Christ as their Lord and Savior.
original_verse_text: (a continuation to previous verses) "So tat in ages to come He might show the surpassing riches of His grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the boundless riches of Your grace, which You have lavished upon us through Christ Jesus. In Your great love, You have saved us from our sins and made us trophies of Your mercy, that in the ages to come, You may display the immeasurable wealth of Your kindness toward us. May we ever be in awe of Your unfailing grace, and may it compel us to live for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: God delights in showing great grace to great sinners. What I see by the words (the ages to come) is that God will show the trophies of His great grace throughout the endless ages of eternity (the great trophies) being all who have accepted Christ as their Lord and Savior.
subject: Trophies of God's Great Grace
verse_text: (a continuation to previous verses) "So tat in ages to come He might show the surpassing riches of His grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"By grace you have been saved through faith; and_

_that not of yourselves, it is a gift from God." _(Eph. 1:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Grace is what God does for man, not what man does for

God or himself. Salvation is God's greatest gift for man's

greatest need. Grace is God's provision, faith is man's

appropriation. Grace comes through God's love - - Faith

comes through the hearing God's Word.

PRAYER FOR TODAY;

I thank You Lord for Your gift of grace which we receive

because of Your love. I thank You too for the gift of faith

which I received through the hearing of Your Word. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Grace is what God does for man, not what man does for God or himself. Salvation is God's greatest gift for man's greatest need. Grace is God's provision, faith is man's appropriation. Grace comes through God's love - - Faith comes through the hearing God's Word.
original_verse_text: "By grace you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves, it is a gift from God. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your abundant grace, which You have freely bestowed upon us through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. In our sinfulness, we stand in need of Your redemption, and we rejoice that salvation is Your gracious gift, not earned by our own works. May we receive this gift with humble faith, as we hear and believe the good news of Your Word. We praise You for Your unfailing love and the riches of Your mercy. Amen.
reflection: Grace is what God does for man, not what man does for God or himself. Salvation is God's greatest gift for man's greatest need. Grace is God's provision, faith is man's appropriation. Grace comes through God's love. Faith comes through the hearing of God's Word.
subject: Salvation Through God's Grace
verse_text: "By grace you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves, it is a gift from God. "
